creator: ps@nomensa.com
text:
Every time you save a document in the default pub using hte Kupu editor multiple
entries are produced for <meta http-equiv="Content-Type"
content="text/html;charset=utf-8"/>

looks like two enties per save:
 - one UTF-8
 - one utf-8

note case

creator: ps@nomensa.com
text:
In fact it should read 2 saves per entry and here some more info:

kupu/apache-lenya/lenya/content2edit.xsl

" <!-- 
      Fix for IE: Special characters e.g. german umlauts are displayed correct
in the document being edited.
      NOTE: This should normally be done by the serialization, 
      but it doen't work in case of usecase=kupu step=content.
   -->
    <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html;charset=utf-8" />
"

is responsible for the lower case version but even if this is removed kupu still
puts in an upper case version (twice).

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
this has been fixed in the kupu 1.2 branch, and will be part of the kupu 1.2
release.
